hypeerweb.broadcast

Class BroadcastVisitorBlackBoxTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • hypeerweb.broadcast.BroadcastVisitorBlackBoxTests
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class BroadcastVisitorBlackBoxTests
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    Tests the specifications for the BroadcastVisitor class.
    Author:
    Craig Jacobson

    • Constructor Detail

      • BroadcastVisitorBlackBoxTests

        public BroadcastVisitorBlackBoxTests()

    • Method Detail

      • testCreateInitialParameters

        public void testCreateInitialParameters()
        Tests for valid output. Since no size method is provided in the Parameters specs the postconditions cannot be fully tested through black box testing.

      • testVisitInvalidCases

        public void testVisitInvalidCases()
        Test invalid parameters for visit (partitioning: invalid cases). 1. null, null 2. node, null 3. null, parameters

      • testVisitValidCases

        public void testVisitValidCases()
        The valid partition is all HyPeerWebs of size >= 1, but there are two partitions in where you can start the broadcast: at node zero, not at node zero. Furthermore, the valid HyPeerWebs can be partitioned into HyPeerWebs that are HyperCubes, and those that aren't. Boundary value analysis: 1. HyPeerWeb size 1, starting at node zero. 2. HyPeerWeb size 2, starting at node zero. Test valid partitions: 3. HyPeerWeb size 32, starting at node zero. 4. HyPeerWeb size 32, starting at the last node (the last node would be a possible boundary for the visit method's start node). 5. HyPeerWeb size 37, starting at node zero. 6. HyPeerWeb size 37, starting at a node that is not zero. Note that the upper bound for HyPeerWebs is too large to test.

      • testOperation

        public void testOperation()
        Tests for invalid inputs into the operation method. Invalid: null values, a node not in the HyPeerWeb, or parameters not originally passed in. Valid: a node in the HyPeerWeb, and the parameters originally passed in. Note that testing whether or not a node was in the HyPeerWeb was done in the testVisitValidCases() method.
